com.evernote.android.job

Interface JobCreator


  • public interface JobCreator
    A JobCreator maps a tag to a specific Job class. You need to pass the tag in the JobRequest.Builder constructor.

    The JobManager can have multiple JobCreators with a first come first serve principle. That means that a JobCreator can block others from creating the right Job, if they share the same tag.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  JobCreator.AddJobCreatorReceiver
      Abstract receiver to get notified about when JobCreators need to be added.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ACTION_ADD_JOB_CREATOR
      Action to notify receives that the application was instantiated and JobCreators should be added.

    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_ADD_JOB_CREATOR

        static final String ACTION_ADD_JOB_CREATOR
        Action to notify receives that the application was instantiated and JobCreators should be added.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • create

        @Nullable
Job create(@NonNull
                     String tag)
        Map the tag to a Job. If you return null, then other JobCreators get the chance to create a Job for this tag. If no job is created at all, then it's assumed that job failed. This method is called on a background thread right before the job runs.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag from the JobRequest which you passed in the constructor of the JobRequest.Builder class.
        Returns:
        A new Job instance for this tag. If you return null, then the job failed and isn't rescheduled.
        See Also:
        JobRequest.Builder#Builder(String)
